page.title: 09FARMING-ARABLE
page.content: There is very little cereal growing in this area.Wheat and oats are the main crops with barley coming a poor third (for feed).Oil-seed rape,beans and potatoes can all be found but in small acreage.The largest proportion of grass is down to permanent pasture used for grazing hay and silage - the latter being the most popular due to its nutritional value as winter feed.Hedges are well maintained and edge most fields.The craft of hedge -laying has been passed down through generations and is still widely used.The land,especially in Ashburnham was once a completely supporting estate.Now it has been sold to individual farmers as small holdings stud or mixed farms.In recent years the sale of tennanted land has altered the whole village community.
